intro: Anisolotus rigidus, commonly known as the rigid anisolotus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lanceolate, hairy leaves that are often gland-dotted. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, producing yellow flowers that are arranged in a dense, compact inflorescence. The species is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, thriving in full sun and exhibiting drought tolerance.
